intro: Epilobium × novae-civitatis, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a hybrid plant species belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. The flowers are typically pink or purple, with four petals and numerous stamens, forming showy clusters at the ends of the branches. This plant is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
